thread.title: Spielberg’s ‘Bridge of Spies’ is much more than a solid ride
thread.title_full: Spielberg’s ‘Bridge of Spies’ is much more than a solid ride - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Mick LaSalle
title: Spielberg’s ‘Bridge of Spies’ is much more than a solid ride
text:
Photo: Jaap Buitendijk, Associated Press In this image released by DreamWorks II Distribution Co., Tom Hanks portrays Brooklyn lawyer James Donovan in a scene from the Steven Spielberg film, "Bridge of Spies." The movie is due to open in U.S. theaters on Oct. 16, 2015. In this image released by DreamWorks II Distribution Co., Tom Hanks...
Watching a Spielberg movie is like riding in the back of an old Town Car. There’s plenty of room, the construction is solid, you know you’re heading somewhere, and even if there are bumps, the ride is always smooth. Indeed, Steven Spielberg is so smooth, so good at what he does, that his best movies have a way of seeming inevitable, when they’re the furthest thing from it. In this image released by DreamWorks II Distribution Co., Tom Hanks portrays Brooklyn lawyer James Donovan in a scene from the Steven Spielberg film, "Bridge of Spies." The movie is due to open in U.S. theaters on Oct. 16, 2015. In this image released by DreamWorks II Distribution Co., Tom Hanks...
